text: Maillol's portrait of his friend, the painter Auguste Renoir contrasts with the majority of the sculptor's oeuvre. He is known primarily for his depiction of female nudes in a formalized manner, which references classical Greek sculpture, much like his <i>Leda<i> on the opposite wall. <i>The Head of Renoir<i>, however, provides an intimate portrayal of the artist's friend.
title: Head of Renoir
